creator: gregor@apache.org
text:
Initialization Problem

ant install with a running tomcat results in the exception below on the next
page view


Message: cannot create a quartz scheduler

Description: org.apache.avalon.framework.configuration.ConfigurationException:
cannot create a quartz scheduler

Sender: org.apache.cocoon.servlet.CocoonServlet

Source: Cocoon Servlet

cause

org.quartz.SchedulerException: Scheduler
'SimpleQuartzScheduler_$_SIMPLE_NON_CLUSTERED' already exists.

request-uri

/lenya/index.html

full exception chain stacktrace

Original Exception: org.quartz.SchedulerException: Scheduler
'SimpleQuartzScheduler_$_SIMPLE_NON_CLUSTERED' already exists.

Apache Cocoon 2.1.1

Cocoon has to be compiled with our local.*.properties.
I guess we have to put this on the website.
creator: egli@apache.org

text: the problem indeed goes away if you do not use the cocoon cron block
creator: gregor@apache.org
egli@apache.org
text:
Ok, it's maybe not a bug, but we need to add this to the installation
description, that Cocoon has to be built without the cron block.

Added a note to the installation desription which tells you that you have to use
the local.*.properties in ./src/cocoon to build your cocoon.
creator: egli@apache.org
